Canonical Variate Scores

cva_scores creates linear combinations of predictor and response variables from the coefficients of reduced-rank canonical variate analysis.

cva_scores(x, y, rank = "full", k = 0)

Arguments

x
data frame or matrix of predictor variables
y
data frame or matrix of response variables
rank
of the coefficient matrix to estimate. Default rank = full prodcues the standard multivariate regression technique.
k
small constant to add to the ridge of covariance matrices to avoid singularity.

Value

list containing: data frame of canonical variate scores of predictor variables; data frame of canonical variate scores of response variables; vector of canonical correlations.

References

Izenman, A.J. (2008) Modern Multivariate Statistical Techniques. Springer.

See also

cva

Examples

library(dplyr)
data(COMBO17)
galaxy <- as_data_frame(COMBO17)
galaxy <- select(galaxy, -starts_with("e."), -Nr, -UFS:-IFD)
galaxy <- na.omit(galaxy)
galaxy_x <- select(galaxy, -Rmag:-chi2red)
galaxy_y <- select(galaxy, Rmag:chi2red)
cva_scores(galaxy_x, galaxy_y, rank = 2)
